1.brief: properly, instrumental music; by implication, a poem set to notes
David, the youngest son of Jesse
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
who? (occasionally, by a peculiar idiom, of things); also (indefinitely) whoever; often used in oblique construction with prefix or suffix
properly, to turn aside from the road (for a lodging or any other purpose), i.e. sojourn (as a guest); also to shrink, fear (as in a strange place); also to gather forhostility (as afraid)
a tent (as clearly conspicuous from a distance)
who? (occasionally, by a peculiar idiom, of things); also (indefinitely) whoever; often used in oblique construction with prefix or suffix
to reside or permanently stay (literally or figuratively)
a mountain or range of hills (sometimes used figuratively)
a sacred place or thing; rarely abstract, sanctity

2.brief: to walk (in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively)
entire (literally, figuratively or morally); also (as noun) integrity, truth
to do or make (systematically and habitually), especially to practise
the right (natural, moral or legal); also (abstractly) equity or (figuratively) prosperity
perhaps properly, to arrange; but used figuratively (of words), to speak; rarely (in a destructive sense) to subdue
the heart (as the most interior organ);

3.brief: not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to walk along; but only in specifically, applications, to reconnoiter, to be atale-bearer (i.e. slander); to lead about
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
the tongue (of man or animals), used literally (as the instrument of licking, eating, or speech), and figuratively (speech, an ingot, a fork of flame, a cove of water)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
bad or (as noun) evil (natural or moral)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to lift, in a great variety of applications, literal and figurative, absolute and relative
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications

4.brief: an eye (literally or figuratively); by analogy, a fountain (as the eye of the landscape)
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
to be heavy, i.e. in a bad sense (burdensome, severe, dull) or in a good sense (numerous, rich, honorable; causatively, to make weighty (in the same two senses)
to seven oneself, i.e. swear (as if by repeating a declaration seven times)
properly, to spoil (literally, by breaking to pieces); figuratively, to make (or be) good fornothing, i.e. bad (physically, socially or morally)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to alter; by implication, to barter, to dispose of

5.brief: silver (from its pale color); by implication, money
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to give, used with greatest latitude of application (put, make, etc.)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to take (in the widest variety of applications)
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to waver; by implication, to slip, shake, fall
properly, concealed, i.e. the vanishing point; generally, time out of mind (past or future), i.e. (practically) eternity; frequentatively, adverbial (especially with prepositional prefix) always
